p: C. albicans ATCC 10231 strain was grown overnight in Sabouraud medium (150 RPM, 30 °C). Cells were washed twice with sterile water and the cell number concentration was adjusted to 10 6 cells per mL in Lee medium [ 43], which induces the growth of hypha forms. Cell suspensions were treated with EOs tested at concentrations equal to MIC or ½ × MIC and were incubated for 2 h or 24 h, respectively. After an appropriate time, the number of mycelium forms was counted in a Thoma cell counting chamber and compared to a control not treated with any EOs.
